name: ICE Cultural Exploration Night - Pakistan Night
location: ICE Office, 1208 Houtex Industrial Building 16 Hung To Road Kwun Tong, KOW
about: Join us for an unforgettable evening as we explore the captivating culture of Pakistan - with a delicious twist! Experience firsthand the traditions, rich real-life stories, and bold flavors that make Pakistan so unique. All from our local Pakistani cultural sharers. In this interactive event, you'll dive into the nationâ€™s heritage and then jump into a hands-on cooking workshop where you'll learn how to create a cherished Pakistani snack that bursts with flavour.Whether you're a seasoned home chef or just curious to try something new, get ready to mix, stir, and laugh your way through an fun culinary adventure. Connect with fellow food enthusiasts in a warm, upbeat atmosphere that promises to leave you inspired and craving more. Let's cook, learn, and celebrate Pakistan together!Reserve Your Spot Today! ğŸŸï¸Spaces for this exclusive Pani Puri experience are limited, so secure your spot now! name: Women Changemakers Gathering in HK: Sound Healing & Creative Writing
location: Dream Impact, Unit C, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road Hong Kong, KOW
about: A safe place for women changemakers (and aspiring women changemakers) to meet one another;A small-scale gathering where you can actually have intentional conversations with everyone;A community you show up and participate equally as an agent of change;A space to exchange stories and find inspirations to bring collective impact;A tribe you can come back to as your support network and build intergenerational friendships.This is what this gathering is about. For women changemakers.On August 10 Sunday afternoon, Carmen Chan of Girls Be Change and Dorothy Lam of Dream Impact are going to team up with published writer Gillian Del Mundo and certified sound meditation healer Carol Lee, to have this special community gathering to connect changemaking, creative writing, and sound healing together. Let's explore our inner creativity and voice to lead change from within.It is a gathering where everyone shows up as an equal participant, questioning and chatting. No panel. No presentation. No speech. Just intentional conversations.Come join us on Aug 10 (Sun) for an afternoon to meet other fellow women changemakers and explore your creativity via soundhealing and writing!What is Women Changemakers Community Series?The idea began in the summer of 2023 when two changemakers in Hong Kong, Carmen (Girls Be Change) and Dorothy (Dream Impact), questioned and envisioned what an ideal community is. We need a safe place among women changemakers to have organic meetups, intentional conversations and idea exchange with social ease, find inspirations and encouragement from each other, and build authentic friendships and support networks.The first Women Changemakers Community Gathering was held in Hong Kong on March 8, 2024 at International Womenâ€™s Day. Ever since then, Girls Be Change cohosted with 20 (and counting) organizations and gathered over 150 (and counting) women changemakers in Hong Kong, Indonesia, Kenya, and Tanzania. With 15+ gatherings around the globe, a vibrant community of global women changemakers was formed and connected virtually to raise questions, exchange ideas, and celebrate wins.â€‹Co-organizers:

name: Anti-Loneliness Club | Dinner with Strangers: Hong Kong
location: Restaurant of the Week, 5 Connaught Road Central #25/F Hong Kong, HKI
about: When was the last time you did something completely spontaneous? Our series groups together complete strangers for a fun night out. That's right, you sign up, and we book the restaurant. We know life can get busy. Don't forget to spend time making new friends! Why do city life alone when you can build your community with us. Embrace the awkwardness of meeting new people for the first time blindly: all ages, interests, hobbies, and backgrounds. This project is to host dinners in 100 cities to combat loneliness in the modern world while supporting locally owned businesses.Each month, dinner is held at a different restaurant. These dinners are not directly associated with the restaurants, but are simply based on a table reservation.This micro-event is intended to be for 4-6 people maximum. If the evening you signed up for does not hit the minimum number of signups, please be open to joining us on another night with a fuller group. Check out our feature in Eventbrite's 2025 TRNDS report about embracing the micro-event trend.How does it work?After you register, you'll be emailed an introduction message. We'll stay in touch with you leading up to the night of the dinner. Expect a Final Details email the day of.*Your registration does not include your individual food and drink purchases. A paid ticket simply makes you more committed to actually showing up.*Sign up one time, and you'll join our database to be invited to all dinners.*These outings are intended to help people make friends. These are not singles gatherings.*If you sign up the day of the gathering and do not get a welcoming message from us in time, simply email ermantourageimpact@gmail.com, request a refund, or please be open to joining us on another evening.Our vision is simple: we take the no gimmicks approach to networking. No need for yet another app to take up space on your phone - just four walls and a roof and good food for people to connect :) We coordinate with you directly, human-to-human.If you have any more questions, please contact ermantourageimpact@gmail.com!Brought to you by event series Ermantourage.You can also take a look at our main event calendar via Posh for coffee meets, evening hangouts, and more!

name: Lisca Bianca, Born Free: The Dream of a Boat That Became a Collective Hope
dateTime: Starts on Thursday, July 24 Â· 6:30pm HKT
location: Blue Room, Soho House Hong Kong, 33 Des Voeux Road West Sheung Wan, HKI
about: As an additional event for the screening of Lisca Bianca and Metamorfosi â€“ Story of a Song of Wood at EU-Asia Docs, the Italian Cultural Institute is hosting a talk on the meaningful project with the founder of the Lisca Bianca Association, Elio Lo Cascio, and the director of the homonymous documentary Giuseppe Galante. Elio will share his experience in the project and how Lisca Bianca affects the lives of the participants.A Q&A session with both Elio and Giuseppe on the project, will be conducted after the sharing. Participants will come together afterwards for a convivial gathering.â€œItâ€™s a story I would describe as magical, in the young people who participate in our programs, I see a deep transformation: they begin to believe in themselves again. They learn that achieving a dream takes courage, hard work, sacrifice, and passionâ€”things they often thought they had lost.â€Elio Lo Cascio, president of the Lisca Bianca Association.Lisca Bianca is a 12-meter schooner that once set sail with the aim to travel around the world. In 2013, Lisca Bianca was found abandoned in a shipyard in Palermo, days away from demolition. Thatâ€™s when sociologist and sailing enthusiast Elio Lo Cascio, along with naval architect Francesco Belvisi, stepped in. Moved by the story told in the travel diary written by Sergio Albeggiani, the previous owner of Lisca Bianca, they saw the boatâ€™s potential as more than a relic: it could become a floating workshop of rebirth.The Lisca Bianca Association was officially founded in 2014 with great help from sponsors and organizations. The restoration of the schooner involved the help from the Palermo juvenile detention center, residents of the Santâ€™Onofrio recovery community, unaccompanied migrant minors, and individuals recovering from workplace injuries.Over time, Lisca Bianca became the heart of a broader vision: vocational training, social inclusion, sailing programs, sustainable tourism, and initiatives in the green and blue economy. On land, the project found a home in Scalo 5B, a vibrant social space in Palermo. At sea, it continues to welcome those in search of direction and a second chance.Lisca Bianca, born freeâ€”continues to sail toward new horizons.Click here for the official website of the Lisca Bianca Association. (In Italian only)

name: Bridging Generational Gaps - Hong Kong, China
location: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Hong Kong
about: ğŸ“£ Are You a Parent of a Child Struggling with Mental Health? ğŸ§¡Feeling unsure of how to best support a child dealing with mental health difficulties can be incredibly overwhelming. This occasion is planned specifically for parents like you who are eager to more deeply understand, connect with, and guide their child during these tumultuous times.This event is tailored to support parents who are naturally relationship-driven and have a desire to influence their child's life positively.You'll gather alongside expert child psychologists and parents who've experienced similar struggles. During our time together, you will:1. Learn how to communicate more effectively with your child, fostering greater openness and understanding in your relationship.2. Acquire tools to assist your child in managing emotions and building resilience.3. Network with other parents, creating a supportive community.4. Recognize how your natural talents and inclinations can best serve your child during these difficult times.A single step can create significant change. We're warmly inviting you to be part of our event: "You Deserve Peace" through empowering your mental health. Together, we can brighten these challenges and forge a better future for our children.This event aims to provide support and education for parents. It does not replace the advice of medical or mental health professionals. Always consult a healthcare professional for personal medical advice.

name: Bridging Leadership and Parenting - Hong Kong, China
location: Hong Kong, Hong Kong Hong Kong
about: ğŸ“£ Support for Parents: Helping Your Child Navigate Mental Health Challenges ğŸ§¡Navigating the uncharted waters of your child's mental health can feel overwhelming, even more when you're used to dealing with complex tasks and making important decisions. We've designed an event specifically for parents like you who bring a strength of leadership into every area of their lives.This unique event will resonate with your natural skills of strategic thinking, goal-setting, and problem-solving - qualities that are essential in supporting a child through such difficulties.Join us as leading child psychiatrists and experienced parents come together to share their insights and personal experiences. You can expect to:Learn effective strategies to communicate with your child, promoting understanding and openness.Acquire tools for helping your child manage emotions and bolster resilience.Network with other parents who share both your challenges and your leadership approach, fostering a community of mutual support.Uncover how your inherent skills in strategy and problem-solving can greatly aid your child during these challenging times.A single informed action can make a significant difference. So join us for our event: "Parents Guiding Through Mental Health Challenges: A Leadership Approach". Here, we will transform these hardships into opportunities for growth together.Please note, this event is designed to educate and support parents. It does not replace professional medical or mental health advice. Always consult with a healthcare professional for personalized medical advice.Join us for insights into managing children's mental health. Learn strategies, meet fellow parents, use your leadership skills. #MentalHealthParenting

name: UNHEARD 2025: Shared Frequencies: How to build community through radio
location: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F Hong Kong, KOW
about: A panel discussion with an assemble of community radios from Asia & Europe discussing the enduring medium of radio and the myriad ways in which  it builds community.w/Arthur Bray from FM Belowground (Hong Kong)Chris  from Res Radio (Vienna)Dana from The Nifty Radio(Jakarta)James from Eaton Radio (Hong Kong)___________________FM Belowground:FM Belowground is a community radio station located in the basement of Landmark Building with a varied programme ranging from local dance and indie bands to podcasts to DJing workshops connecting people from different backgrounds and creative practices.Res Radio:Res.Radio is a non-commercial community webradio based in Vienna to strengthen and display subcultural genres. From its founding in 2019, the radio grew into a multicultural community/platform featuring artists with many different backgrounds. Within this platform people connect, exchange ideas and create content around music across all genres and talks, which addresses topics like contemporary culture, social injustice and other phenomena. Res.Radio is a space of diverse artistic freedom and is made from people for people.___________________The Nifty Radio:The Nifty Radio (Nifty) is an alternative music radio and archiving platform community-based in Bogor, notably in the electronic music scene. Providing a place for DJs, musicians, and music geeks from all over the world to promote, distribute, and create new connections, in line with the growth of the music ecosystem surrounds them. Presenting various types of music, and the sub-genres in it, also come with the artistic and visuals that represent the circumstances of the city.@mortarwithpestle / @theniftyradio____________________Eaton Radio:Eaton Radio empowers grassroots storytelling and supports emerging, contemporary, and historic underground music. Weâ€™ve produced over 2000+ shows of talk radio and music through a rich and varied rotation of DJ mixes, interviews, and regular shows.

name: 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair
location: Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1  Expo Drive Wan Chai, HKI
about: Welcome to the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair!Meet over 50 leading law firms, professional legal organisations and law schools in Hong Kong - all gathered under one roof to offer you insights, guidance, and opportunities to connect with the legal profession.This is your chance to ask questions, explore career paths, and build networks that matter.Free admission is offered to penultimate LLB, double law degree and JD students. Law students from other years are also welcome to register for free admission, but is subject to availability.Non-law and LLM students are welcome to attend with a registration fee of HKD 500, and admission is subject to a quota.Registration is required to attend, and successful registrants will receive a QR code before the event.We look forward to seeing you at Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre!*In the event of adverse weather conditions (e.g. T8 or above, or a Black Rainstorm Signal), the Law Fair Committee will consider rescheduling the event to Sunday, 7 September 2025, subject to venue availability. Further details will be announced if this occurs.
